ruleName: Control flow exceptions must be rethrown
description: When catching exceptions in a generic catch block (Throwable), control flow exceptions should be rethrown rather than being swallowed or just logged. Control flow exceptions (like InterruptedException, CancellationException) are part of the application's control flow mechanism and should propagate up the call stack to be properly handled. Failing to rethrow these exceptions can lead to unexpected behavior and difficult-to-trace bugs.
